title: Can we see our progress on our honor level?
body: It would just be nice to see if I am actually moving up and getting close to leveling up.

replies.body: I'd be down.
I don't see why this wasn't already with the system when it came in.
According to Riot they didn't want it to be seen as a "grind". However, it feels even more like a grind because you have no idea how long it will take.

Instead of just making the system better for everyone, they chose to punish everyone under the assumption that their system is easy to abuse (which speaks for the quality of Riot's work and this toxicity obsession they have).
It is just really odd. Every game I wonder when I will rank up that by the time I would actually rank up, all enjoyment or excitement for that rank up is drained.

But they also said it's basically different for each player.

"Our behind-the-scenes systems which determine honor level ups aren't simple. The types of calculations we do to determine if a player is ready to level up take into account their holistic behavior across many games, and don't lend themselves well to being surfaced in an "XP bar"-style system. Anything we surface here could also warp "

So having an XP Bar sort of thing wouldn't help this.

Very true. Overall it's hard moving forward to know where you stand within the system as a player unless you've already gone through it once completely and you don't change what your doing at all. Which is completely unlikely.

One suggestion I saw that I liked was having the honor icon on your profile grow brighter as you got closer to leveling up. It's a neat idea that would kind of mimic a XP bar but still give the player feedback. Like, "Good job man, keep it up!"
That's a great idea.
That's what I thought. It's just a little visual thing to let people know that you are almost there. Just keep up the good work.
Percent Bar then.

"Grind" is not something you can define in League as a negative term.
Everything you do in League is a grind. You're grinding SQ, normal games, IP, account levels, mastery levels, honor levels, skill experience... you name it.

Saying that you need an XP bar to make it feel like a less of a grind isn't even remotely true. The only reason to not make it feel like a grind is if you don't worry about it and play normally. If you feel pressured every game about who you're going to honor and if someone is going to honor you, then you're not having a good time in general.
From what I understood, the only way to go down was getting punished.

Riot will never add this and they've already responded why. They don't want people to game the system by faking being nice when they're near a level up or knowing they can be assholes for a certain amount of games because it's gonna take a while before they drop down a level. The actual quote is:

"Hey, this is a good question, but we actually very intentionally did not include any sort of progress indicator for Honor levels. Here are a few reasons why:

1. We didn't want to anchor people on the "grind" to honor levels. By not having progress indicators, we wanted to root the reinforcement for being sportsmanlike on the feedback you get from other players (the honors), not any artificial motivation from being "close to the next level".
2. Our behind-the-scenes systems which determine honor level ups aren't simple. The types of calculations we do to determine if a player is ready to level up take into account their holistic behavior across many games, and don't lend themselves well to being surfaced in an "XP bar"-style system. Anything we surface here could also warp behavior around trying to "minmax" the most honor points, which really refocuses it away from the point of the Honor system - play good games and you'll make progress.
3. We wanted to have a few discrete levels in Honor, since bloating the number would make each feel less meaningful. However, we wanted players to progress over the course of a season or half-season, which means that progress to the next level would necessarily be fairly slow. We didn't think it would be a great experience to reinforce this through some progress indicator."

The system still feels annoying. Getting tons of honors, carrying games and just being a good player to every doesn't really feel like you are being rewarded. Sure I got 2 honors X game but I don't feel like I am making any progress. It's just a more visual version of the old system where I would just get a ribbon once in a blue moon, and I would forget about the system all together. 

Another issue is the player has no idea if their honors mean as much as the guy who plays 10x the amount. If I play 3 games a day or twice every couple of days, I have no idea if my honors are being matched to the guy who put 20 games in. I think because we don't know how it works and because it's all invisible, we as the players feel like it's a slog to get to at least honor level 3. It's also easy to drop levels as many players are honor level 1 or 0.

> [{quoted}](name=Kloqdq,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=wqZXLR6N,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-07-17T16:51:46.370+0000)
>
> It's also easy to drop levels as many players are honor level 1 or 0.

You only drop levels if you're punished in some way (also low priority queue doesn't count as a punishment I think).
Yeah but it's still easier to drop then go up. Not everyone will drop as long as your just a decent person.

Of course that the guy who gets more honor will level up faster.
Why is this even an issue? How can you equalize a common player who can get a few good games a day to someone who can get 20 good games a day? This is basically the same as asking if a player who can play more games a day than you will get levels faster.


You don't even have to get honored a single game during an entire season and you'd still level up eventually, albeit a lot slower than a honored player would. As long as you're not getting punished by the instant feedback system, your honor levels won't drop under any circumstances and you'd at least be at a neutral level, where the usual key frag drops aren't impacted. So you're entitled to 100% of the loot and everything above level 2 is a bonus you're getting.

It doesn't really matter how close to a level up you are.
The system isn't something you should "grind" for anyway. Being honor should be a privilege, not your right. Which means that it's up to your teammates to judge what kind of potential you had in a given game and if they want to honor you or not. There shouldn't be any pressure to be forced to honor anyone, if you don't want to.

I think it's mostly the way it was originally shown to me. My understand of the system at first was basically, you will go up and down all season and if you are a good person, you'll stay higher levels of honor. This system just feels like a slog that doesn't reward me at all. I play TT a lot so I normally get an honor or two (It's a lot easier when there are only 3 team members) and I have no idea if I have actually gone anywhere. Hell the keys I get is so small in number I wonder if I am even getting rewarded for all the work I put towards not being human garbage. 

I just want to know if my honors mean anything. I don't even care if I get honored at this point. I have no reason to care because the system doesn't give me any reason to care. By the time I would reach honor level 3, just like everyone else, the actual feeling of reaching that point will just be, "That it...?"

The old system was not any better all be it, which is the problem. Clarity is all I want, and I sure it's what everyone else wants. I just don't want the system to just die in the water because it just all happened so slowly.

The number of keys you're getting now are the same. 12 frags a month (4 keys) is max but before, you had to actually win games to be eligible for this loot. Which meant you either had to be insanely good at league and win most of your games (therefore playing less games overall) or had to grind a lot of games and win at least 50% of them to see if a drop happens.

In any case, in the earlier system, key drops were all focused on the first few drops and they were frequent, with less and less drops as the time went on. I myself managed to get 9 frags a month, and that was around 40 wins (with a 50% win rate, that's 80 games overall). This really wasn't feasible for people who had less time than me to play League and this new system doesn't even require you to win. Just play games and drops are smoothed out across the month. 

Getting to higher Honor levels is really irrelevant by the number itself.
There are better rewards and flair when you go higher but overall, people are in it for the loot. Being neutral (level 2) means exactly the same rewards as before (12 frags a month) and level 3 and higher means loading screen flair from the honor you received and a chance to drop Honor Capsules (2 key frags guaranteed as drops or 2 skins - WW and Twitch). Loading screen flair you get when you get honored by 3 people at least in the previous game and you get to keep them for exactly one game. Higher levels means more flashier flair (loading screen borders).

#That's all honor is for.
The side benefit of the system are the rewards. The main benefit of the system is that we all know you're not a dick. The problem i'm seeing here is that a lot of people just want to minmax the system and want to know their progress and this is the most irrelevant when it comes to sportsmanlike behavior. Consistency of the behavior is relevant, your honor level is not. Higher honor levels mean that you are a good player across many, many games and since higher honor levels take a long time to reach, it also means that you're consistent. Your XP bar for honor levels does not play any relevant role in this system.

Then in that way the system fails because it doesn't meet that desired goal. Really I would rather just get flairs if I get a handful of honors and skip the stupid levels. The levels are what is making this system feel terrible. 

If the system worked like, if you get honored you will get a loading screen banner, similar to the current system. As you get more honors and you get more banners, your banners will get grander, just like the level 4-5 banners. The higher you overall banner level the more likely you are to get the capsules. Then at the end of the season depending on your overall performance on honor, you got max level a handful of times. You will be rewarded. 

The system is then consistently acknowledging your efforts to be a better player, while also not gating you to your sick rewards. You will see that banner, gain bigger and better banners are you level up and over time as you get higher rewards, you may get those rewards.

The idea is the same at the core but it removes the most annoying elements of both the new AND old system. Having it be super rare and unknown makes it forgettable. Having it be gated and grind-y is just painful to play with. The system I suggested would make it easier to get the banner overall, but having you need to be consistent, and rewarding you quicker for being consistent. And as you go up, you have a better chance to get rewarded with something cool. 

I just hate having to look at that honor level 2, and think how I get all these honors, and it doesn't matter. By the time I get level 3, I will have stopped caring all together. Just like the old system. That is all this system is going to become, something forgettable.

Let me get this clear:
The Honor system right now rewards you for being a sportsmanlike player, which it determines by having you get honored by teammates for your various actions and consistency of the behavior (half-season or season). This takes time to accumulate and level up so it's obvious that for putting the time and effort into being a good player, will get you rewarded in the end.

And yet, you want partial rewards now, without the need to verify if you're sportsmanlike or not? What point of an Honor system would again be if you'd be getting immediate rewards? One good game on your side doesn't mean you're a decent player that won't flame people. That would only influence people into begging for honors or honoring others that don't deserve them, just for the borders. The same way premades were doing it before. There was no point in ribbons as they never indicated why they were for. They were just spammed on top of people in order to get them, in the majority through ARAM games.

Secondly, everything you do in League (or any game for that matter) is a grind. You're grinding IP for champions, for chests, for keys, for account level, for champion levels, for champion mastery, for your own skill level... "Grinding" is nothing more than investing time and effort into getting what you want and need. If you need ribbons, the path to them is pretty clear:

#Be a sportsmanlike player.
And since it takes quite a while to get to those, you can't fake your shit and grab fast honors and get borders that way. Getting Honor isn't a grind and Riot made sure your progress isn't noted anywhere because they didn't want to encourage minmax behavior of "i have this much to get honored to the next honor level". The fact that you don't know how long you have will make you either get your shit straight and dedicate yourself to being a good player or you'll quit faking it and won't get to higher levels by pretending you're good.

Honor isn't something an honorable player needs to pay attention to. It comes naturally. Your Honor XP doesn't indicate whether you're a decent player or not, just like your account level doesn't indicate whether you're a skilled player or not. Getting to higher Honor levels isn't a milestone you need to mark on your calendar, it's an attitude adjustment that people need to work on their own. Riot said they're going to put honor counters in the future but won't be adding an Honor XP bar to indicate your honor levels.

As it stands, i agree that Honor is rather a hidden system that doesn't really indicate anything about you so i would like to get at least honor counters, which we had before.
That way, it would indicate on your profile that you're a player that is getting honored but for the rest of "transparency of Honor leveling", it's not going to happen.

>I just hate having to look at that honor level 2, and think how I get all these honors, and it doesn't matter. By the time I get level 3, I will have stopped caring all together. Just like the old system. That is all this system is going to become, something forgettable.

Getting honored does matter. But you don't see that.
And you shouldn't care about the Honor system just because you want loot. The point is to be(come) a sportsmanlike player and if you aren't that guy, you aren't supposed to leech off it. It's not supposed to be a burden or pressure to get honored or to give honors and you won't forget about it because at the end of each game, you're asked to honor someone or skip the ceremony altogether.

You can't turn this off so you're stuck having to look at that screen for a long time, which always reminds you that it is there. Whether you want to use it or not, that's your own thing. And there will be times where you'd honor people (even if they are rare occasions) and the system is for that. Not just spamming honor at every chance you get but give honors to people who deserve them.

I don't want loot? I am just saying, this system is a pain that doesn't solve the problems of the old system. THE old system is almost the same to this one. The only difference is it's shoved down your throat. You can still skip it and in fact a lot of people will skip honoring. You don't have to honor nor do most people want to. Hell most games it's just a guessing game of who to honor because maybe everyone is good.

MY idea isn't just giving you things for free. You can beg to be honor but no one has to honor you. You need to play a good amount of games to actually get rewarded still but it removes a lot of the "honor level" stuff. THE MAIN ISSUE HERE.

Honor level is the problem. Having levels that you can visible stare at is just a pain and not seeing it go up is annoying. I am not the only one that feels this way. I could care less about the loot. I just want to see that number go up at this point. IF you have level 1-100 with no rewards but you went up quicker than it would probably be better then this mess. Having a number that never moves and never shows progress is a dumb idea. Sure you're not meant to think about it but for a lot of people it is right there. Not everyone can just forget about that Level 2 Honor that is still not going up. And you know what? The problem with last with level 4 and level 5. The problem is with the number value put on the system. 

Removing it all together and being passively rewarded in the background would actually be better. Because then it's not in the forefront. That's the BEST kind of reward. The ones that just come out of nowhere. You aren't waiting for them to come and you don't see it coming. This system breaks both of those. You are actively waiting and thinking about not the rewards, but your level going up. If this system was put into place, but the only change was the honor level was removed and it was all behind the scene stuff, this would be a great system. 

When your boss offers to buy you lunch you are happy for it and it feels good because you didn't expect that. But if he were to offer it too you, but you had to wait and you were kept waiting, it would get annoying and when it actually happens you may not even care at that point. That's my point. Either remove the levels although, or make the system more visible.

How do you expect visibility and for people to care if Honor isn't the first thing see at the end of each game? How can Riot make it visible enough so that people feel compelled to click on it, rather then to just gloss over the fact that it used to be a tiny button everyone forgot existed as there were no incentives to use it frequently?

Now, with loot, there are incentives to use it and an overlay before the end game screen, makes sure it's visible. It isn't showed down your throat. The fact that you can skip it means that you can honor people if you feel like it or not if you don't. If it was shoved down your throat, there wouldn't be an option to skip it nor would there be a timer. You'd be sitting there for an eternity if you didn't want to honor anyone. These are two major differences between "hey, you CAN honor someone if you want" and "you aren't playing any more games UNTIL you honor someone".

Honor levels aren't going away.
This is a way to differentiate between higher tier rewards.
The Honor EXP bar isn't happening either. 

>Removing it all together and being passively rewarded in the background would actually be better. Because then it's not in the forefront. That's the BEST kind of reward. The ones that just come out of nowhere.

That's exactly what's happening right now!
You don't know when your keys are going to drop, they just happen. And it is the same as other rewards. Get to higher levels and flairs are guaranteed if you get honored 3 or more times per game. Honor Capsules are still random but they only have a chance to drop at level 3 or higher. Higher tier rewards warrant higher level of Honor. It seems to me like you want to have your cake and eating it as well.

You want every drop to be random (a surprise) without the BS with levels. Your idea isn't good as this would mean any player (sportsmanlike or not) can just get lucky and draw lucky loot. The point of the system is to reward sportsmanlike players and this is what level 3 and above do. The first level up means that, across half a season, you had showed that you are truly honorable for a longer period of time. _** That's the point of the system.**_ To differentiate between players who kept their honorable status for long periods of time and make sure that the path to sportsmanlike behavior isn't easily faked by pretending to be nice for a time or just getting lucky and getting higher tier loot and being a total dick.

Your progress towards a higher level is irrelevant as this would reinforce bad behavior Riot is trying to avoid - honor shouldn't be ground by brute force. It should be a background system that tracks your honorable status and it shouldn't bother you. There are other ways of showing some kind of a progression and that doesn't imply only implementing an EXP bar to track your progress as your only means to do so. Riot is going to add more stuff to Honor in the future.

Your analogy isn't a correct correct one as well.
You get better benefits for a better paying position in the company and you started from the bottom. If you want those benefits, you aren't getting them if you don't earn them. Your boss isn't just going to surprise you with an unexpected reward like that, if he didn't feel like you earned a promotion.

I do not believe it's doing it's job. it's as simple as that. The actual level aspect is the problem that everyone is having with the system. I am merely offering solutions and saying, yes having levels is dumb and it's either something you need to fix or remove.

I understand your point but I think many people agree with what I am saying as well. Both sides are right. Neither is wrong. I like the way everything is right now expect for that stupid level. That is the major thing. It's why people want a bar or some visual example of you progressing. I am offering solutions, and you have offered nothing but disapprovement. 

A large amount of people are not happy or disappointed. You cannot just say, "Well suck it up." Offer me a solution because at this point I cannot say anything more without repeating myself. It's the same position Riot is in right now. The system is just lacking in my eyes and many others.

No, people aren't unhappy with the new Honor system.
In fact, all i've heard is that Honor is now more fun to give and think who to give out to but the only issue is that it's simply there and we have no indication of our Honor progress nor how much honors we've accumulated. This did express itself through "we need an EXP bar" argument but Riot said no and had a legitimate reason to back their stance up.

I also agree that the system right now feels invisible but adding honor counters would solve those invisibility problems in the majority of cases. The problem is that we have no indication that we're progressing and an EXP bar isn't the only solution they can to implement so we can see out progress.

This is a good behavior system and you need to show it that you're a good player. So you can't get away with not having some sort of an indicator that requires time to definitely prove that (experience or a timer). None of your proposed solutions address this problem. What you are gunning for is really equality between players and the truth is that not every player is a sportsmanlike player. Number of honors shouldn't matter for rewards as this would only force people to honor others that might not deserve them. Honor should be an opt-in experience, not something Riot forces people to give and get in order to get better rewards.

 Having random loot fall into your lap is still bad design as then the chances would have to be rather small and some players might get them immediately, some players might not get them in years. This system can't just be pure lottery.

---
The only thing i'm proposing is a bit more fleshed out honor progress in terms of honor counters. That's all it needs currently, in my opinion. There's no need for some other major overhaul as the system works as intended. If there need to be EXP gain adjustments, Riot can do that as well, if they feel the progress is slower than intended. Right now, it's faster because it introduced almost half way into the season.

I highly doubt they will make it any faster. The core root of the problem is just a system that doesn't feel right. Even a tally system showing how many honors you get is kind of pointless because that's just like the old system. Which I'd imagine 90% of the player base forget existed on their profile. 

My idea isn't just making it so the tyler1s or those guys being generally unfun people to play with, having an equal ground for honor. The way you honor is the same. All I suggest is speed up the process and have those banners unlock and upgrade after a good number of honors. If you get honored 100 times and you see no benefit for it, then so what. A number isn't going to make you feel any better, especially when that's all it is, a number. 

If I get honored 50 times, I would get a ribbon, then I have to actively keep up my good behavior to keep it and keep progressing. No one in there right mind actually honors people that beg for honors. It's annoying and it's the internet. If you are begging for honors you are more likely going to be mocked and laughed at. Your idea doesn't solve the problem, and my probably doesn't either. 

That's probably linked to the main root of the issue being that not everyone will agree or enjoy something and not everyone is going about the system in the same manner. I am sure even in Riot there is people that like and dislike the system. So can we fix the system? No, I don't think so. Either the fix is too much or will feel like a cheap bandaid fix. I just don't like the way the system grinds along and the thought of it moving slower will just make me care even less about it. Then again you have to understand I thought the system was going to be _active_. Throughout the season you would be going up and down. That's how I understood it when I first saw it and I liked that idea. It meant I had to be actively working towards being a good person. Now that I see it moving slower than a freaking snail, of course I am annoyed.

It's almost like you get rewarded by being acknowledged for playing well and winning games. 
It's almost like you don't deserve shit for doing what you should. 
It's not like you can't get honors by not talking either. 
It's not hard to not be a shit person. Stop whining when you somehow accomplish that.
What's wrong with fake nice? I'd rather have "fake" nice than toxicity any day.
It's more the knowledge that you can be toxic for x games and maintain your "honor."
well i mean if you are toxic you arent dropping but you certainly arent rising. so whats the point.

Good points on their part, though it'd still be nice to have some indication. Maybe have the honour icon change as you progress. Like add certain, noticeable decorations to it based on % to rank up, or something.
As it is, it feels like a grind anyways just one without any progression or end. Another nice thing to have would be a counter of all your honours like in the old system

If I were to guess why people are pushing for this, I would feel some of the supports are just backing it because they want to grind it out, and/or have the knowledge on how toxic they can be from time to time and remains clear from punishment.

I do not think adding a meter will do any good at all. In fact, it will destroy the point of the system if you add a meter.

This system really is just a carrot on a stick, let us be real. The point of having carrots on a stick is that the horse is chasing after the carrot, not knowing when it will fall into its mouth, so it will try its hardest to obtain it, no matter how many steps it will take. This is what Riot is aiming for, if you do not know how much you have to behave, it will encourage players to behave at their best all the time.

If you give it a meter, it will form a routine. Now the horse will demand carrots based on how many steps they've taken on a fixed rate. This totally destroys the point of the system, because people are no longer forced to behave at their best, but how much they have to behave, and how much they can misbehave before facing consequences.

Do you seriously think that is going to be a good idea, Riot? I do not think so.

In fact, this system is just there to reward those who can at least behave like a decent human being, there is literally 0 drawback and only climbs if you don't troll every game. Do you believe those who ask for tangible and fast rewards, and planning grinding to get rewarded for something as simple as being decent, as well as using the meter to keep an eye on just how "good" they have to be, are deserving of those honour rewards in the first place? This new system really doesn't change anything from the past, mind you, as long as you don't get punished for being a prick anyway, so why are some of us so desperate to level and plan the grind for it?

Some people will always use the reasoning that people are more likely to output if they know how much they need to, arguing for the existence of the honour meter. But here's the kicker, that only applies if the whatever system in question is a grind. Honour system is never meant to be a grind like IP to buy champs or something. That's why that reasoning is false. The premise of the system is that "you might get rewarded if you never get banned", it really is never meant to be a grind. And I also do think some of that percentage-ish algorithm from the previous Honour system is also used in the current one because I'm sure I heard or read that somewhere it was said that beyond raw numbers, rate is also used as part of the calculation or something, in order to prevent people just grind it out with the number of games played or that people can't get it because they don't play as much or something (which I hope is true).

Do not just listen to the whim of some of us on the community, go through it and have a think about it yourself.

................

TL;DR Adding a meter destroys the point and the design of the system on various levels. So no.
You're right giving you a reason to behave all the time is a good system but how long do you think that's going to work before people get sick of getting nothing?

> [{quoted}](name=Vastaylan,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=wqZXLR6N,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2017-07-18T09:53:10.815+0000)
>
> You're right giving you a reason to behave all the time is a good system but how long do you think that's going to work before people get sick of getting nothing?

I think those who're only trying because of the rewards don't really deserve the goodies reserved for honourable players in the first place. So if they want to call it quits purely because of the rewrads and stuff not coming so soon or something, that's kinda up to them.

EDIT: As long as the progression and its interworking is actually fair, it really doesn't matter whether or not you can see the progression. And as explained before, I feel giving a meter does more detriment than it helps. But that's my view on this.
Im going to have to disagree with that I would rather have fake nice than toxic.

> [{quoted}](name=Vastaylan,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=wqZXLR6N,comment-id=0009000000010000,timestamp=2017-07-18T10:10:10.473+0000)
>
> Im going to have to disagree with that I would rather have fake nice than toxic.

I don't disagree with his sentiment. In fact, it's part of why I oppose the introduction of honour meters. Because meters gives the player how much they have to behave, so they can work out how much they can be toxic too. That's why if fake nice is better than toxic, imo you will oppose the honour meter, as without knowing how much one has to behave, it forces them to behave at their finest.

You're probably talking about the scenario where "people get bored because of no progress so they troll", but then again, wouldn't this also happen if they know they're climbing too slow even with the meter in place? In other words, it falls onto Riot to design a reasonable climbing mechanism and other calculations within the system, and it really doesn't matter whether or not it is visible to the players in this scenario.

And for the other arguments I've put out, I believe not having meters strongly outweighs the benefits of having one, and it also doesn't validate the purpose of the system.

Listen if they fit in time to troll eventually they're going to get banned being reported once might not get you in trouble right away but that's because they want you to reform but it will not be tolerated forever every report on you that's correct stack's up until they believe you're not reformed and then you receive the punishment. I went over that because if you're punished which will happen eventually if you're trolling then you wont just go down one level I am pretty sure you go to the dishonorable rank.

I went over that because if you're punished which will happen eventually if you're trolling then you wont just go down one level I am pretty sure you go to the dishonorable rank.

Precisely, that's why the meter isn't needed. Because there is no need to know how much you need to behave to go to the next honour rank, as that information itself destroys the purpose of the system, or at the very least half of it.
We just went in a full circle with this discussion how else would there be an issue despite what we just talked about?

> [{quoted}](name=Vastaylan,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=wqZXLR6N,comment-id=00090000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-18T10:36:42.957+0000)

The "don't want a grind" thing is what made it clear to me. Games are built on grinding, and gaming companies embrace the idea of grinding to keep you playing. If there is something to grind for, but you actually get penalized for grinding the grind too quickly, then shit gets sideways with the player base. Legitimate grinds are always out there in the open for you to chase, like grinding ip, grind XP, grinding Mastery levels, etc. We know what they are, how they work, and that there is actually a carrot on the stick. Honor is the opposite, and for all we know, it's just a stick. 

Anytime you offer a player base rewards for doing this much of 'x', it's a grind any way you look at it. If the grind is being artificially stagnated with limiters and bullshit behind the scenes emergency brakes, you have to drop the "yeah we just want people to behave and stuff, and like, it's not a grind guys, but yeah".
